column5: Well, here's our new family member. Introducing "Ozzy" our Victorian Bulldog. He's quite the little ham with lots of attitude and personality. Looking forward to years of fun and companionship from him.  One blue eye and one brownish green.    Whew...luckily I installed that fire hydrant in the yard!! LOL  Thanks for all the name ideas.........it came down to Hank and Ozzy. My youngest boy made the choice since my oldest boy named my late dog Domi 14yrs ago. Only fair I thought.  Colin
Who can't help but love a love a puppy ??  Boy, your kids are gonna love that little guy !!!!
Makes you wish you had a fire hydrant in your back yard too doesn't it Paul?
Well done I think a family is not complete unless you have a pet included.   Art

Im lovin all these pup pics. And this guy is no exception. Ive never heard of a Victorian bulldog? Post lots of pics of him growin up, im curious to see what he looks like all grown up. Which as you know.......wont take long lol
What a cute dog, I have a real soft spot for bulldogs. Just love them. Congrats on the new family member.

LOL..I like it too! I got that hydrant from Base Borden in Angus about 10 yrs ago from the water/sewer crew. They were going around replacing all the older ones and I was making sure they didn't dig up our fibre optic cables so they offered it to me. I also got one for my dad as well.
Here's a pictures of Ozzy's dad. I think there's a resemblance.
To WHO.....  Nice puppy........lots of fun and work in the near future.  Good Luck, Bob
hes cute for sure !!!!   dam i wish i had a fire hydrant in my yard too...
Oh wow!! Ill SAY.......chip off the old block lol. THanks for posting that.

Wow what a beautiful pup!  I had never heard of a 'Victorian Bulldog' before...but googled it.  Apparently a cross between 4 breeds.  I know that one of the breeds was a Staffordshire Bull Terrier....my absolute all time favourite dog......   Thanks for posting...what a great addition to the family.
